title: Irregular high ping during patch 6.18?
body:
Hi, I'm not entirely sure if I am the only one experiencing this higher than usual ping this Patch. It just started out of nowhere about 3-4 days ago I've been logging on each day testing ping in Custom games, there was a thread awhile back about the same issue I always played with 74 ping but now it's 100-200+. I don't get any reconnects in game, I do lose a bit of frames every so often but I don't see how this can just suddenly happen? People keep telling me to get better internet but I was able to play League flawlessly before then, I'm able to play games on consoles just fine so I don't think my internet is the problem here. I would like some help. It's not really the first time this has happened either, it happened back when the servers were changing around. 

I'm in a reserve so getting better internet wouldn't be very possible for me but I am being 100% honest when I say I don't have terrible internet that makes playing online unplayable, I have been able to play games back to back in the past and this change in ping is recent. I hope that this can be fixed or a cause of it to be found. {{item:3070}} 

_Sincerely, Me._

I believe I have fixed with with a simple repair of the client.

replies.body: Hi! Thank you so much for the reply, I thought repairing the client had fixed the problem because when I had hopped into a game I was sitting at 73Ping for a bit but then it went back to 100+ ping lower than before I gotta say. I'm also on Windows 10 if that helps with anything, I've seen some people say that Windows 10 is the cause of it but I'm not entirely sure I'm not all that much of a whiz. T_T
Were you able to work through the connection guide I linked and observe any change in your latency?

I also have tried many things to resolve my ping issue. i have NEVER had ANY issues with ping what so ever, until i downloaded patch 6.18.
I have changed my network channel, Installed the repair tool, changed DNS codes ( i also notice there is no setting for Windows 10 solution on the solutions page) nothing has resolved my issue, This needs urgently attending to, as i haven't been able to play the game for the past 3 days! - This is the most frustrating thing to have to deal with in regards to League as there is always some form of "other reason" as to why it isnt working. i feel like ive tried everything

Since patches only update or create files in your League directory, they're *very unlikely* to affect your connection. If you haven't already, I definitely recommend working through all the steps in the connection guide I linked above to ensure your local settings aren't conflicting with League.

Let me know if you continue to have latency problems.
Just wanted to add that in having pretty much the exact same issue. Always had a stable ping at 29, but I've been having 60+ping recently.
My ping and fps have horrible since the update

I'm extremely sorry about the tardiness of my reply I decided to wait until the next patch came out for there to be any difference at all due to there not being any solutions with Windows 10 currently.

If you're still experiencing high latency, I recommend reaching out in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to our tech team. Running a set of logs with our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) and attaching them to your ticket is a great idea and will expedite your service.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
